messages.text: AI, what is Test first programming?
Test first programming is a software development methodology in which unit tests are written before code is written. This helps ensure that the code meets the requirements set forth by the tests.
biasanya domain & interfaces first, lalu minimal implementation (with bunch of TODO markers), lalu bikin tests, barulah full implementation
what is the alternative?

There is no one-size-fits-all answer to this question, as the best development methodology for a given project will vary depending on the specific context and constraints. However, some common alternatives to test-first programming include waterfall development and agile development.

text:
Nah iyah gini maksud aku om jadi yang handle si domain model ini si repositorynya ane ngutip dari sini om.


The repository is implemented in the domain layer, because it works with domain objects. But in the domain layer we should have no idea about any database nor any storage, so the repository is just an interface.

AI, what is entities in context of data persistence?
In context of data persistence, entities are the objects that are persisted in the database. These objects have a life cycle and a state that is persisted in the database.

messages.text: I'm glad to hear you're using Creature from now on!
Tapi beberapa ngebedain karena definisi ini sih om berkaitan sama data persistence

Some people may differ in their definition of data persistence, but this one is specifically in relation to objects that are persisted in a database. These objects have a life cycle and a state that is kept in the database.
AI, what is the structure of clean architecture

Clean architecture is a software design principle that separates the elements of a software program into distinct sections, such that each section has a specific purpose. This allows for a greater level of flexibility and modularity, as well as easier maintenance and debugging.
pengen rasanya ngasih contoh. tapi projectnya ngga ada
its not that simple

I understand that you may feel that the concept of clean architecture is somewhat complex. However, I assure you that it is actually quite simple once you get the hang of it. If you have any specific questions, I would be more than happy to answer them for you. Otherwise, I suggest looking for some online resources or tutorials that can help explain the principle in more detail. Thank you for your question!
no, clean architecture does not guarantee modularity and flexibility

Thank you for your input. While clean architecture does not explicitly guarantee modularity or flexibility, it does promote these qualities by separating the elements of a software program into distinct sections. This allows for each section to be more focused and easier to modify or replace, if necessary.
it does
